NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Motor vehicles for the transport of 10 or more persons
Motor vehicles for the transport of fewer than 10 persons

CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Personnel Transport Support — Provision of Self Drive Hire Vehicles and Driven Coaches — Oman

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Motor vehicles. Motor vehicles for the transport of 10 or more persons. Motor vehicles for the transport of fewer than 10 persons. The Authority has a requirement for the provision of White Fleet vehicles — including Coaches — in multiple locations throughout Oman. The proposed contract shall be for a period of one (1) year commencing 1.7.2018 and ending 30.6.2019 with the option to extend for up to 6 months.
This requirement has been broken down into a total of 9 Lots based on location:
— Lot 1 Duqm,
— Lot 2 Mussanah,
— Lot 3 RAO Shafa Camp,
— Lot 4 RAFO Thummrait Camp,
— Lot 5 Murtafaat Al Matar,
— Lot 6 Muscat Airport,
— Lot 7 Adam,
— Lot 8 Ras Bin Tawt,
— Lot 9 All Locations.

It is the Authority’s aspiration to place one contract for all requirements, however it is recognised that better value for money may be achieved by placing contracts with different companies for the above Lots. Expressions Of Interest (EOIs) can therefore be submitted for all Lots or for individual Lots. If a company wishes to Bid for the entire requirement they should use ‘Lot 9 — All Locations’.
The Authority would be happy to consider company’s acting alone or working together in a partnering or joint venture arrangement.
Within a 12 month period it is estimated that a total of approximately 322 hire vehicles shall be required, although these figures may fluctuate in accordance with demand.
EOIs must clearly state which Lots a company is expressing an interest in and must contain details of your company to include the following information:
— Company point of contact details for future correspondence (e-mail, telephone, postal address, web site),
— Company registration details.

In order to express an interest in this tender and for access to the Statement of Requirement please ensure you are registered as a Supplier on Defence Contracts Online (https://www.contracts.mod.uk).

Expressions of interest and the required Pre-Qualification Questionnaire (PQQ) are to be submitted in English, by 1600 UK TIME on 27.4.2018. Any expressions of interest received after this time and date will not be considered.
Please note only those who pass the PQQ shall be invited to tender (PQQ Access Code SS487893Q3).

This Contract notice is not to be construed as confirmation that a tender/contract will subsequently be issued; announcements are for information only. Any expenditure, work or effort undertaken prior to contract award will be at the Supplier’s own risk.
Should you have any questions please contact Lisa Buckley, Commercial Manager on DEFComrclCC-JFC7b@mod.uk

OPTION_DESCRIPTION.P: There is an option to extend for a total duration of up to 6 months.

PTAR_JUSTIFICATION.P: To meet the deadline of an urgent operational requirement

OPE_OBJECTIVE_CRITERIA.P: The top 6 scoring Bidders following the Pre-Qualification evaluation shall be invited to tender.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.The Authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy. If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a Security Aspects Letter), the Authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise. The link below to the Gov.uk website provides information on the Government Security Classification.
Advertising Regime OJEU: This contract opportunity is published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU),the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk
The Access Code required for the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire is SS487893Q3.
Suppliers must read through this set of instructions and follow the process to respond to this opportunity.
The information and/or documents for this opportunity are available on http://www.contracts.mod.uk

You must register on this site to respond, if you are already registered you will not need to register again, simply use your existing username and password. Please note there is a password reminder link on the homepage.
Suppliers must log in, go to your Response Manager and add the following Access Code: 97MY9Q753N.
Please ensure you follow any instruction provided to you here.

The deadline for submitting your response(s) is detailed within this contract notice, you will also have visibility of the deadline date, once you have added the Access code via DCO as the opening and closing date is visible within the opportunity.
Please ensure that you allow yourself plenty of time when responding to this opportunity prior to the closing date and time, especially if you have been asked to upload documents.

If you experience any difficulties please refer to the online Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ’s) or the User Guides or contact the MOD DCO Helpdesk by emailing support@contracts.mod.uk or Telephone 0800 282 324.
